error.signature: fatal: no submodule mapping found in .gitmodules for path 'X'

verdict.summary: Git submodule not initialized. Common after cloning a repo with submodules.

dead_ends.action: Delete the submodule directory and re-clone the whole repo
dead_ends.why_fails: git submodule init is much simpler

dead_ends.action: Copy the submodule code directly into the repo
dead_ends.why_fails: Defeats the purpose of submodules â€” lose upstream updates

workarounds.action: Initialize and update: git submodule init && git submodule update
workarounds.how: git submodule init && git submodule update

workarounds.action: Or clone with submodules included: git clone --recurse-submodules <url>
Update to latest: git submodule update --init --recursive

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'fatal' indicates a missing Git submodule mapping, while 'You are in 'detached HEAD' state' indicates a detached HEAD state (not on any branch).
'fatal' indicates a missing Git submodule mapping, while 'Already on 'main'' indicates already on the requested branch.
